intro: Cleistopholis myristiciflora, commonly known as the myristiciflorous cleistopholis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces dark, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, and it thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
